docs.lead_paragraph: Dance pioneer Martha Graham, a member of the Little Rock Nine and the founder of the Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Foundation are among 10 women who will be enshrined in the National Women's Hall of Fame, the hall announced Tuesday.

headline.main: Graham, Little Rock 9 Member Head for Women's Hall of Fame
headline.print_headline: Graham, Little Rock 9 Member Head for Women's Hall of Fame

docs.snippet: Dance pioneer Martha Graham, a member of the Little Rock Nine and the founder of the Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Foundation are among 10 women who will be enshrined in the National Women's Hall of Fame, the hall announced Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers have long puzzled over why children in India, despite being wealthier, are shorter and smaller than children in sub-Saharan Africa.

headline.main: Many Young Indian Women Underweight, Their Babies Too-Research

docs.lead_paragraph: The woman behind a high-profile gender bias lawsuit against a major Silicon Valley venture capital firm testified Monday that a male colleague was "relentless" in his pursuit of her and cut her out of email chains and meetings when she broke off their affair.

headline.main: Woman: Male Colleague at Venture Firm 'Relentless' in Affair
headline.print_headline: Woman: Male Colleague at Venture Firm 'Relentless' in Affair

headline.main: New Research on Antidepressants and Pregnancy Finds No Link to Asthma

docs.abstract: New research suggest that taking S.S.R.I.s while pregnant does not increase the risk of asthma in the resulting babies, but the decision to take medication or not remains difficult.
docs.snippet: New research suggest that taking S.S.R.I.s while pregnant does not increase the risk of asthma in the resulting babies, but the decision to take medication or not remains difficult.

docs.lead_paragraph: Suggestions on where to go, and how to travel, for parents taking their kids on the road for spring break.
docs.snippet: Suggestions on where to go, and how to travel, for parents taking their kids on the road for spring break.

docs.lead_paragraph: Disputes over teaching kids about their bodies are only growing.

headline.main: The World’s Problem With Sex Ed
headline.print_headline: The World’s Problem With Sex Ed

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Jonathan Zimmerman observes that globalization has served to curtail rather than expand school-based sexual instruction in many liberal, Western nations; notes in past three decades immigrants have joined native-born conservatives to push back against public-health teaching, arguing it infringes on tradition and corrupts children; reminds educators there is little scientific evidence to support such claims.
docs.snippet: Disputes over teaching kids about their bodies are only growing.

docs.lead_paragraph: American Dustin Johnson's break from the game appears to have served him well -- after six months out of the sport he returned last month and on Sunday won the elite WGC-Cadillac Championship at Doral.

headline.main: Doral Winner Johnson Tight-Lipped About Reasons for Break
headline.print_headline: Doral Winner Johnson Tight-Lipped About Reasons for Break

docs.snippet: American Dustin Johnson's break from the game appears to have served him well -- after six months out of the sport he returned last month and on Sunday won the elite WGC-Cadillac Championship at Doral.

docs.lead_paragraph: Zakia and Mohammad Ali had faced criminal charges and death threats after eloping and fleeing their village in the high mountains of central Afghanistan last year.

headline.main: Back in Afghanistan, Modern Romeo and Juliet Face Grave Risks
headline.print_headline: Back in Afghanistan, Modern Romeo and Juliet Face Grave Risks

docs.abstract: Zakia and Mohammad Ali, couple who fled mountain town of Bamian, Afghanistan, in 2014 under threat of criminal charges and death after eloping against their families' wishes, have returned home, but are living in constant state of fear; village police have promised them safety but both Zakia, a Sunni Muslim, and Mohammad, a Shiite Muslim, question how much real protection they will have.
docs.snippet: Zakia and Mohammad Ali had faced criminal charges and death threats after eloping and fleeing their village in the high mountains of central Afghanistan last year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Responses to an Op-Ed essay that criticized a drug aimed at women who lack sex drive.
docs.snippet: Responses to an Op-Ed essay that criticized a drug aimed at women who lack sex drive.

docs.lead_paragraph: We need to conduct more randomized experiments.
docs.abstract: Gray Matter column by author and scientist Anthony Biglan warns that study of terrorism has not lead to more effective antiterrorism policies because the right kind of research is not being done; underscores importance of evaluation research in determining effective antiterrorism tools, and notes that only two experimental evaluations of antiterrorism strategies have used randomized trials.
docs.snippet: We need to conduct more randomized experiments.
